instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: Got this very dirty machine that gives no POST and off corse remain in black screen, I cleaned it up also with IPA can't see any corrosion or damaged components but still run only in SMC mode then I'm guessing its is an issue with the SMC but how do you troubleshoot SMC issues?

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: Apply some flux on SMC and heat to about 150ºC....

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: Some measurements first. What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, I suspect corrosion around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: il check it tomorrow and will update..thanks.

threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4318"]Apply some flux on SMC and heat to about 150ºC....[/QUOTE]

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: The heating did the trick though no boot on ssd so i turned it off and reset smc and its back to no POST once again..

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: Maybe to much crap under SMC, you need to reball the chip......

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Pro 15" Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST only in SMC mode
threads.message: Got it done after heat on SMC and GPU (probably crap)  works fine the last two hours...thanks a lot guys!
